title: Ballard House Asbestos Abatement
description: The purpose of this work is to provide a hazard free base for Construction Operations to install new flooring on the 2nd floor hallways/common area. The current flooring is glued down carpet over glued down VCT. The 12” x 12” VCT mastic tested positive for asbestos and will need to be professionally removed by a certified company.

title: Title Insurance Escrow & Related Services
description: The Seattle Housing Authority (SHA) is seeking a qualified professional firm to perform the title examination process, escrow services, information retrieval, posting, copying and other related services as needed. The estimated cost is not-to-exceed $500,000.00 over a five-year period.

title: In-Unit Wi-Fi Initiative
description: The Seattle Housing Authority (SHA) is seeking proposals from qualified firms to provide consultation and design services of in-unit Wi-Fi internet access systems, with the opportunity to install, maintain and support in-unit Wi-Fi internet access to individual residential units. The scope initially will be a pilot program consisting of six-to-eight SHA residential properties with an approximate total of 525-residential units. Most of the locations already have common area Wi-Fi.

title: New-Used Light-Duty Vehicles
description: The Seattle Housing Authority is requesting bids for up to 21 light-duty vehicles to fulfill the agency's needs.

title: ERP & HRIS Requirements
description: The Seattle Housing Authority (SHA) seeks to replace its Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Human Capital Management (HCM) system. SHA is now seeking a qualified Proposer to configure and implement an ERP/HCM system. The new software platform will be used to support the Finance, and Human Resource functions within the organization.

title: Replacement of Vapor Barrier & Crawl Space Insulation + Insulation of Water Supply System at 2400 East Union, Seattle, WA
description: SHA is issuing an Informal Solicitation for Vapor Barrier & Crawl Space Insulation + Insulation of Water Supply System at 2400 East Union, Seattle, WA

title: On-Call Environmental Services
description: This solicitation will be used to establish on-call contracts with one or more Consultants who are certified in environmental assessment to prepare Phase I and Phase II Summary Reports as defined below in the Scope of Work under section A for various SHA properties, in addition to properties SHA is potentially evaluating for acquisition. The Phase I Summary Reports are a typical requirement of financing due diligence of which the report(s) will be used to refinance each property. Reports may also be used in the acquisition or financing of real estate, or for any reason SHA deems necessary or appropriate. This solicitation will develop a bench of consultants from whom SHA will be able to request Work Orders under an on-call basis. The Contracts executed under this solicitation may be extended annually for a period up to 5 years. The work will be assigned by Work Order. All Work Orders under the Contract shall not exceed $250,000 over a 5-year period.

title: Sub-Metered Utilities Service Provider
description: The Seattle Housing Authority (SHA) is seeking a qualified professional firm to assist SHA in processing and collecting bill payments according to SHA billing practices, and repair and maintain sub-metering equipment as needed.

title: Fire Sprinkler Head Replacement Multiple Sites
description: SHA is seeking bids from qualified Contractors to remove and replace existing fire sprinkler heads located in common areas, units, and parking garages. This is a “like for like” replacement project.

title: Center West Generator and Upgrade
description: SHA is seeking bids from qualified Contractors to replace and upgrade the generator at Center West. SHA will also be upgrading the size of the generator to add capacity for adding the elevator on to the generator circuit.

title: Case Management for SHA LIPH High-Rise Buildings and JobLink Clients
description: Assist SHA in providing general case management services to elderly residents and non-elderly residents with disabilities residing in the SHA facilities and Limited Partnership facilities operated and managed by SHA and in any other facilities as may subsequently be added by change order to the contract. Proposers must propose on all SHA facilities and Limited Partnership facilities.

title: RVIII Fire Alarm Control Panel (FACP) Replacement Project
description: Remove and replace 34 fire alarm control panels (FACP’s) within Rainier Vista III (NE)

title: Backflow, Sprinklers, Fire Alarm Testing & Certification
description: Friday, August 9, 2019 - 4:00pm

title: 11736 Pinehurst Way NE Garage Door Install
description: SHA is seeking a Contractor to install a new automatic garage door to cover an existing opening on outside of a building.

title: Lake City Court New NVR
description: Thursday, August 10, 2017 - 1:00pm
